page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The village of Collingtree gets itÂ£s name from CollaÂ£s tree,Colla being an abreviation of St. Collumba to whom the parish church is dedicated.The villages Collingtree and Milton Malsor were at one time one parish and part of the estate of Sir Roger Wake.Sir Roger Wake fought for King Richard III at the Battle of Bosworth and as a result of supporting the losing side had all his estates confiscated.Sir RogerÂ£s grave cabe found in the nearby church at Blisworth.Later the lands were restored to the family and their descendants now own the neighbouring Courteenhall Estate.During the 19th. century much of Collingtree was owned by the Phipps family who made their wealth from the local brewery.This family made many gifts to the village including the founding of the school.
